title: TravelBot
description: An interactive chatbot that provides personalized responses to user input. My first JavaScript project.

title: Guess Who-game
description: A JavaScript-coded take on the game 'Guess Who?'. Employing essential array methods like filter(), forEach(), and map(). This project significantly enhanced my understanding of JavaScript scope, object manipulation, and array utilization.

title: Weather App
description: An app showcasing weather and forecast data fetched from a free API. Effectively introduced me to API integration, fundamental JSON handling, implementation of fetch(), and working with promises.

title: Music Releases
description: My first React project, displaying music releases from one of Spotify's static APIs. Incorporated iterative map() operations and API integration, this time in React. Introduced foundational concepts like React components, modules, JSX, and props.

title: The Afrobeats Quiz
description: A survey built in React using controlled form inputs. Explored React state management, employed the useState hook, and implemented dynamic component rendering.

title: FlixList
description: A React application displaying the latest movie releases with data sourced from a free API. This collaborative project makes use of React Router for multi-page navigation.

title: Design Handoff
description: A design handoff collaboration with a student from Technigo's UX Design Bootcamp. Developed using React and styled entirely with Styled Components, demonstrating adept translation of design concepts into a functional and visually appealing application.

title: React-Redux Quiz
description: A multiple-choice quiz game designed to test the user's React knowledge, developed using Redux for state management.

title: ToDo App
description: A todo app developed with React, Redux and Styled Components. This project provided hands-on experience with fundamental Redux concepts, including creating new slices, reducers and actions to streamline data handling and effectively manage state within a Redux environment.

title: The Labyrinth
description: An engaging 8-bit-style interactive labyrinth game created with React, Redux and a text-based adventure game API. This group project gave us an opportunity to collaborate on writing thunks to manage asynchronous actions, enriching the game's interactivity and user experience.

title: IT Salaries 2020
description: A RESTful API developed with Node.js and Express. The frontend showcasing the API is built with React and React Router. I recently migrated this project from JavaScript to TypeScript.

title: Happy Thoughts
description: A Twitter-like messaging app enabling users to post, like, and delete messages. I used MongoDB on backend to configure endpoints, store data, and handle user input.

title: PlantMama
description: My final project at Technigo's Frontend Developer Bootcamp, PlantMama is a full-stack platform for houseplant enthusiasts. React and Redux on frontend, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB on backend. Deployed on Google Cloud and MongoDB Atlas. A collaboration with a fellow Developer student and a UX Design student.

title: Wordee
description: A React Native app that generates a random word and gives its definition, synchronizing data across two separate APIs. Given the opportunity, I'd also consider App Store publication.

title: Vue Banner
description: A Vue.js component that slides out from the bottom of the screen and invites the user to a Facebook group relevant to the location of the property listing. Utilized to enhance user engagement on YourPropertyAbroad.com

title: Notes App
description: A job interview task involving the recreation of a Dribbble design in code. My objective was to replicate the original as closely as possible, using React and Tailwind CSS. See the design inspiration here. This effort, showcasing my technical and design skills, resulted in a job offer for a Junior Frontend Developer position.
